message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest peptic ulcer disease which is commonly caused by Helicobacter pylori. The urea breath test is the most accurate way to diagnose it. Helicobacter pylori serology can be used for screening but is not reliable for diagnosis. Proton pump inhibitors can be used to relieve symptoms but are not diagnostic. Helicobacter pylori eradication therapy should only be initiated after diagnosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest possible Helicobacter pylori infection or peptic ulcer disease. The most appropriate next step is to perform a urea breath test to confirm the diagnosis of H. pylori infection. Helicobacter pylori serum IgG test is less sensitive and specific than the urea breath test. Helicobacter pylori eradication therapy can only be started after a positive confirmation, and proton pump inhibitors can help manage symptoms but will not diagnose H. pylori infection.
